alert.note: Alert for Accomack (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 12:29PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Somerset, southwestern Worcester and Accomack Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1229 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Lawsonia to 8 miles northwest of Onancock. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pocomoke City, Onancock, Parksley, Onley, Lawsonia, West Pocomoke, Marion Station, Accomac, Melfa, Bloxom, Saxis, Wachapreague, Painter, Hallwood, Keller, Horntown, Harborton, Mappsville, Goodwill and Greenbackville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
